Class DatasetUtils

extends Object
    Utilities for manipulating datasets

      • transpose

        public static Dataset transpose(IDataset a,
                int... axes)
        Permute copy of dataset's axes so that given order is old order: 
          axisPerm = (p(0), p(1),...) => newdata(n(0), n(1),...) = olddata(o(0), o(1), ...)
  such that n(i) = o(p(i)) for all i
        I.e. for a 3D dataset (1,0,2) implies the new dataset has its 1st dimension running along the old dataset's 2nd dimension and the new 2nd is the old 1st. The 3rd dimension is left unchanged.
        Parameters:
        a -
        axes - if null or zero length then axes order reversed
        Returns:
        remapped copy of data

        public static Dataset sliceAndConvertLazyDataset(ILazyDataset lazy)
                                          throws DatasetException
        Slice (or fully load), if necessary, a lazy dataset, otherwise take a slice view and convert to our dataset implementation. If a slice is necessary, this may cause resource problems when used on large datasets and throw runtime exceptions
        Parameters:
        lazy - can be null
        Returns:
        Converted dataset or null
        Throws:

                                       boolean shareData)

        Returns:

      • norm

        public static Dataset norm(Dataset a)
        Function that returns a normalised dataset which is bounded between 0 and 1
        Parameters:
        a - dataset
        Returns:
        normalised dataset

      • norm

        public static CompoundDataset norm(CompoundDataset a,
                   boolean overAllElements)
        Function that returns a normalised compound dataset which is bounded between 0 and 1. There are (at least) two ways to normalise a compound dataset: per element - extrema for each element in a compound item is used, i.e. many min/max pairs; over all elements - extrema for all elements is used, i.e. one min/max pair.
        Parameters:
        a - dataset
        overAllElements - if true, then normalise over all elements in each item
        Returns:
        normalised dataset

      • lognorm

        public static Dataset lognorm(Dataset a)
        Function that returns a normalised dataset which is bounded between 0 and 1 and has been distributed on a log10 scale
        Parameters:
        a - dataset
        Returns:
        normalised dataset

      • lnnorm

        public static Dataset lnnorm(Dataset a)

        Parameters:
        a - dataset
        Returns:
        normalised dataset

      • centroid

        public static double[] centroid(Dataset a,
                Dataset... bases)
        Get the centroid value of a dataset, this function works out the centroid in every direction
        Parameters:
        a - the dataset to be analysed
        bases - the optional array of base coordinates to use as weights. This defaults to the mid-point of indices
        Returns:
        a double array containing the centroid for each dimension

        Parameters:
        d -
        value -
        Returns:
        list of interpolated indices

      • crossings

        public static List<Double> crossings(Dataset xAxis,
                     Dataset yAxis,
                     double yValue)
        Find x values of all the crossing points of the dataset with the given y value
        Parameters:
        xAxis - Dataset of the X axis that needs to be looked at
        yAxis - Dataset of the Y axis that needs to be looked at
        yValue - The y value the X values are required for
        Returns:
        An list of doubles containing all the X coordinates of where the line crosses

      • crossings

        public static List<Double> crossings(Dataset xAxis,
                     Dataset yAxis,
                     double yValue,
                     double xRangeProportion)
        Function that uses the crossings function but prunes the result, so that multiple crossings within a certain proportion of the overall range of the x values
        Parameters:
        xAxis - Dataset of the X axis
        yAxis - Dataset of the Y axis
        yValue - The y value the x values are required for
        xRangeProportion - The proportion of the overall x spread used to prune result
        Returns:
        A list containing all the unique crossing points

      • removeNansAndInfinities

        public static void removeNansAndInfinities(Dataset a,
                           Number value)
        Removes NaNs and infinities from floating point datasets. All other dataset types are ignored.
        Parameters:
        a - dataset
        value - replacement value

      • makeFinite

        public static void makeFinite(Dataset a)
        Make floating point datasets contain only finite values. Infinities and NaNs are replaced by +/- MAX_VALUE and 0, respectively. All other dataset types are ignored.
        Parameters:
        a - dataset

      • findFirstOccurrences

        public static IntegerDataset findFirstOccurrences(Dataset a,
                                  Dataset values)
        Find first occurrences in one dataset of values given in another sorted dataset
        Parameters:
        a -
        values - sorted 1D dataset of values to find
        Returns:
        absolute indexes of those first occurrences (-1 is used to indicate value not found)

      • findIndexesForValues

        public static IntegerDataset findIndexesForValues(Dataset a,
                                  Dataset values)
        Find indexes in sorted dataset of values for each value in other dataset
        Parameters:
        a -
        values - sorted 1D dataset of values to find
        Returns:
        absolute indexes of values (-1 is used to indicate value not found)

      • roll

        public static <T extends Dataset> T roll(T a,
                         int shift,
                         Integer axis)
        Roll items over given axis by given amount
        Parameters:
        a -
        shift -
        axis - if null, then roll flattened dataset
        Returns:
        rolled dataset

      • rollAxis

        public static <T extends Dataset> T rollAxis(T a,
                             int axis,
                             int start)
        Roll the specified axis backwards until it lies in given position
        Parameters:
        a -
        axis - The rolled axis (index in shape array). Other axes are left unchanged in relative positions
        start - The position with it right of the destination of the rolled axis
        Returns:
        dataset with rolled axis

      • flipLeftRight

        public static <T extends Dataset> T flipLeftRight(T a)
        Flip items in left/right direction, column-wise, or along second axis
        Parameters:
        a - dataset must be at least 2D
        Returns:
        view of flipped dataset

      • flipUpDown

        public static <T extends Dataset> T flipUpDown(T a)
        Flip items in up/down direction, row-wise, or along first axis
        Parameters:
        a - dataset
        Returns:
        view of flipped dataset

      • rotate90

        public static <T extends Dataset> T rotate90(T a)
        Rotate items in first two dimension by 90 degrees anti-clockwise
        Parameters:
        a - dataset must be at least 2D
        Returns:
        view of flipped dataset

      • rotate90

                             int k)

      • select

        public static Dataset select(BooleanDataset condition,
             Object x,
             Object y)
        Select content according where condition is true. All inputs are broadcasted to a maximum shape
        Parameters:
        condition - boolean dataset
        x -
        y -
        Returns:
        dataset where content is x or y depending on whether condition is true or otherwise

      • select

        public static Dataset select(BooleanDataset[] conditions,
             Object[] choices,
             Object def)
        Select content from choices where condition is true, otherwise use default. All inputs are broadcasted to a maximum shape
        Parameters:
        conditions - array of boolean datasets
        choices - array of datasets or objects
        def - default value (can be a dataset)
        Returns:
        dataset

      • choose

        public static Dataset choose(IntegerDataset index,
             Object[] choices,
             boolean throwAIOOBE,
             boolean clip)
        Choose content from choices where condition is true, otherwise use default. All inputs are broadcasted to a maximum shape
        Parameters:
        index - integer dataset (ideally, items should be in [0, n) range, if there are n choices)
        choices - array of datasets or objects
        throwAIOOBE - if true, throw array index out of bound exception
        clip - true to clip else wrap indices out of bounds; only used when throwAOOBE is false
        Returns:
        dataset

      • calcPositionsFromIndexes

        public static List<IntegerDataset> calcPositionsFromIndexes(Dataset indices,
                                            int[] shape)
        Calculate positions in given shape from a dataset of 1-D indexes
        Parameters:
        indices -
        shape -
        Returns:
        list of positions as integer datasets

      • calcIndexesFromPositions

        public static IntegerDataset calcIndexesFromPositions(List<? extends Dataset> positions,
                                      int[] shape,
                                      int... mode)
        Calculate indexes in given shape from datasets of position
        Parameters:
        positions - as a list of datasets where each holds the position in a dimension
        shape -
        mode - either null, zero-length, unit length or length of rank of shape where 0 = raise exception, 1 = wrap, 2 = clip
        Returns:
        indexes as an integer dataset

        Serialize dataset by flattening it. Discards metadata
        Parameters:
        data -
        Returns:
        some java array

        public static Dataset extract(IDataset data,
              IDataset condition)
        Extract values where condition is non-zero. This is similar to Dataset#getByBoolean but supports broadcasting
        Parameters:
        data -
        condition - should be broadcastable to data
        Returns:
        1-D dataset of values
